Description: Fragment of upper body of East Greek black-figured pottery closed vase; dull white slip; black-figure decoration consisting of male figures; of first figure, only one raised hand remaining; of second part of head, upper body and arms, held forwards, to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.059)
